briefdescription.para: Flat row-major storage of matrix elements.
Matrix dimensions.
A vector containing row indices.
A vector containing column indices.
true if vectors are optimized for insertation, false if optimized for retrieval
Returns the total number of elments in the matrix.
Returns the size of the data array.
Constructs an empty sparse COO matrix with given dimensions.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes internal storage with a small reserved capacity and sets the fast insertion mode according to fastInsert.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in the matrix.
Number of columns in the matrix.
If true, enables fast insertion mode (default: true).

briefdescription.para: Constructs a sparse COO matrix from a 2D std::vector.

detaileddescription.para: Non-zero elements from the input vector are inserted into the sparse matrix. If fastInsert is true, elements are inserted in append mode and finalize() must be called manually before sorted access (e.g., get()).

parameterdescription.para: Enables fast insertion mode if true (default: true).

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::array< std::array< T, Cols >, Rows > &arr, bool fastInsert=true)
memberdef.name: SparseCOOMatrix

param.type: const std::array< std::array< T, Cols >, Rows > &

briefdescription.para: Constructs a sparse COO matrix from a fixed-size std::array.

detaileddescription.para: Non-zero values in the 2D array are inserted into the matrix.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in the static array.
Number of columns in the static array.
Fixed-size array of values to initialize the matrix.
Enables fast insertion mode if true (default: true).

briefdescription.para: Constructs a sparse COO matrix from a nested initializer list.

detaileddescription.para: This allows convenient initialization using brace-enclosed lists. Only non-zero elements are stored. Rows must be of consistent length.

parameterdescription.para: Enables fast insertion mode if true (default: true).
if inner lists have inconsistent sizes.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< T > &flat_data, std::size_t r, std::size_t c, bool fastInsert=true)
memberdef.name: SparseCOOMatrix

briefdescription.para: Constructs a sparse COO matrix from a flat vector in row-major order.

detaileddescription.para: Only non-zero values are inserted into the matrix. The resulting matrix will include only the explicitly stored entries. If fastInsert is true, entries are added in append mode and require finalize() before sorted access.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in the matrix.
Number of columns in the matrix.
Enables fast insertion mode if true (default: true).
if the size of flat_data != r * c.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor for SparseCOOMatrix.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new SparseCOOMatrix as a deep copy of the provided matrix. All internal data structures (values, row/column indices, flags) are duplicated, preserving the state of the original matrix while ensuring full independence.

simplesect.para: This performs a deep copy. Changes to the new matrix will not affect the original.

briefdescription.para: Move constructor for SparseCOOMatrix.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new sparse matrix by transferring ownership of data from another matrix. This constructor performs a shallow move of internal vectors and resets the source matrix to a default, empty state.

This is more efficient than the copy constructor, as it avoids deep copying of data and instead reuses existing memory buffers. After the move, the source matrix is left in a valid but unspecified state (typically empty).

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to move from. After the operation, other is empty.

simplesect.para: The fast_set flag is also transferred and reset in the source.

briefdescription.para: Accesses a matrix element (read-only).

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the value at the specified row and column. If the element has not been set, throws an exception.

simplesect.para: The value at the given position.

parameterdescription.para: if indices are out of bounds.

briefdescription.para: Deep copy assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para: Copies all metadata and contents (rows, cols, data, etc.) from another SparseCOOMatrix. The two matrices become fully independent.

briefdescription.para: Move assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para: Transfers resources from another SparseCOOMatrix, leaving the source in a valid but empty state. Enables efficient transfer of large matrices.

briefdescription.para: Performs element-wise multiplication of two sparse matrices.

detaileddescription.para: Multiplies corresponding non-zero elements where both matrices store a value. Returns a new SparseCOOMatrix containing only the overlapping non-zero positions.

parameterdescription.para: The other SparseCOOMatrix to multiply with.
if the matrix dimensions do not match.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of rows in the matrix.
Returns the number of columns in the matrix.
Gets a matrix element.

detaileddescription.para: Implements the MatrixBase interface.

briefdescription.para: Creates a polymorphic deep copy of this matrix.

simplesect.para: Unique pointer to the copied matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::size_t r, std::size_t c, T value) override
memberdef.name: set

briefdescription.para: Sets a value in the matrix at the given (row, column) index.

detaileddescription.para: If fast_set is true, the value is appended without checking for duplicates or maintaining order (O(1) insertion). This is efficient for bulk construction but requires calling finalize() before reliable queries.
If fast_set is false, the method performs a binary search and inserts the value at the correct sorted position. Duplicate insertions will throw.

parameterdescription.para: if value already exists and fast_set is false.

briefdescription.para: Updates an existing value in the matrix at (row, column).

detaileddescription.para: Performs a binary search for the target index. If the element is found, the value is updated in-place. If the element does not exist, an exception is thrown (you must call set() first).
This method requires finalize() to have been called if the matrix was initially constructed in fast insertion mode.

parameterdescription.para: New value to assign to the existing element.
if the element is not already set.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether an element at (row, column) has been initialized.

detaileddescription.para: Searches for the target index using binary search. The result is reliable only if finalize() has been called after using fast insertion mode.

simplesect.para: True if the element has been initialized (i.e., set or updated).

briefdescription.para: Finalizes the internal COO representation for querying.

detaileddescription.para: This method is required after using fast insertion mode (fast_set = true) to sort the (row, column, value) triplets into lexicographic order. Once finalized, efficient binary search and reliable get/update/is_initialized operations are enabled.
This method performs a stable sort and disables fast insertion mode.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the matrix is in fast insertion mode.

detaileddescription.para: This method reports the current status of the fast_set flag. When true, the matrix is in fast insertion modeentries can be appended quickly without maintaining order or checking for duplicates. When false, the matrix is in finalized mode and supports efficient retrieval operations (e.g., via binary search).

simplesect.para: True if the matrix is in fast insertion mode; false if finalized.

briefdescription.para: A sparse matrix implementation using the Coordinate List (COO) format.

detaileddescription.para: This class stores non-zero elements of a matrix using three parallel vectors: one for row indices, one for column indices, and one for the data values. It supports two operational modes:

listitem.para: **Fast Insertion Mode (fast_set = true)**: Allows fast, unordered appends of (row, column, value) triplets. This mode is ideal for incremental construction of the matrix but requires a call to finalize() before performing reliable access or update operations.
**Finalized Mode (fast_set = false)**: Ensures the internal storage is sorted lexicographically by (row, column). Enables efficient binary search for get(), update(), and is_initialized() methods.

detaileddescription.para: The class conforms to a polymorphic base class MatrixBase<T>, allowing it to be used in a generic matrix interface with other matrix types such as dense or CSR.
